intro: Diplazium squarrosum, commonly known as the hairy shield fern, is a species of fern native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Hemionitidaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, shield-shaped fronds. The plant has a creeping rhizome and produces sporangia on the underside of its leaves. Diplazium squarrosum thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. Its leaves are covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance.
